Class Supernode

java.lang.Object
org.derekn.p2pSim.NetworkNode
org.derekn.p2pSim.PeerNode
org.derekn.p2pSim.Supernode
public class Supernode extends PeerNode
Represents a Supernode in the P2P network, a high-capacity peer with enhanced upload and download capabilities. Supernodes are designed to handle more connections and serve as efficient hubs for data distribution.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Supernode

      public Supernode(int id, double x, double y, int totalChunks)
      Constructs a Supernode with enhanced bandwidth characteristics. Upload and download speeds are boosted compared to standard peers.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the node
      x - X-coordinate for visual placement
      y - Y-coordinate for visual placement
      totalChunks - Total number of chunks in the file

  • Method Details

    • getNodeType

      public String getNodeType()
      Returns the string identifier for this node type. Used in visualization and logging.
      Specified by:
      getNodeType in class PeerNode
      Returns:
      "Supernode"

    • canAcceptMoreConnections

      public boolean canAcceptMoreConnections()
      Determines if the Supernode can accept more peer connections. This limit is higher than regular peers, supporting up to 12 connections.
      Returns:
      true if connections are below 12; false otherwise
